Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2014 07:37PM hopeful123 wrote: Dear Ann- I think the imaging techniques are not as accurate and cannot determine micromets. So the fact that you have micromets doesnt necessarily mean you didnt respond to treatment. You still have radiation and Tamoxifen to keep things in check. You are luminal A it appears, and this has one of the best prognosis. I know of two people who are close friends one Stage IIIb and another Stage IIIc who had a similar pathology to yours at diagnosis and are  5 and 8 years out. Keeping you in my thoughts and prayers.
Posts.Title: Finished Chemo and have residual tumor and multiple micromets ann273 hopeful123

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 07:02AM hopeful123 wrote: Thanks cycle-path and Marie. Yesterday evening was the first time since my US that I was not sulking. While it could just be my harmonal mood swings (I am 45),I think a large part of it had to do with just connecting with this forum of people who have been through or are going through what I am going through. I feel ready to face whatever the results bring on. As cycle-path put it, I am not on the Titanic (cycle-path -I am afraid I like the Titanic better )
Posts.Title: Worried hopeful123 hopeful123

Posts.Content: hopeful123 wrote: Hello, I went in for a screening mammogram Jan 8th and they found calcifications. Followup diagnostic mammogram followed by US was done Jan 12th. They found a 3 cm mass along with two other smaller masses at the same site as the calcifications. The radiologist and doctor said it looks very suspicious didnt give me a score. She did look at all the surrounding lymph nodes and said they looked good (didnt know you could say much about lymph nodes involvement with US). My PCP called and said it was a 50-50 chance that it was cancer (again not sure how she came up with this number). Now waiting for biopsy to be done Jan 24th. This wait is killing me. I am a type A person that stresses out about every little thing in life. I am so glad I found this forum and can vent without feeling guilty. Thanks for listening to me. Lata Dx 1/2012, IDC, Stage IA, Grade 3, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

The little details that are so irrevalent yet take up so much of our time...  Keeping fingers crossed for all of us.
